result.execSummary:
The defendant Devontae L White was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use Dangerous Weapon (Misdemeanor)], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Decision and Order DENYING Request for Good Time signed and filed.  Copies to the District Attorney's Office and defendant.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Timothy M. Witkowiak, Br. 22, for review.  jbs
Defendant's pro se request for good time.

Defendant Devontae L White not in court, defendant in custody.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered 09/02/2015 sentence vacated.  10/15/2015 hearing sentencing to remain:

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 1 YEAR at the House of Corrections with 7 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence/count with Huber.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 2 YEARS probation.

As to Count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 DAYS at the House of Corrections with 90 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence/count.  TIME SERVED.

  Conditions of Probation:
- 6 MONTHS condition time at the House of Corrections with Huber.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- No possession of firearms or ammunition.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- No contact with the Edward C or Scoteria F.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution set at zero; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter

Letter from DOC seeking clarification of sentence.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 1 YEAR 3 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 97 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence/count with Huber.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 2 YEARS probation.

As to Count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 DAYS at the House of Corrections with 97 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence/count.  TIME SERVED.

  Conditions of Probation:
- 6 MONTHS condition time at the House of Corrections, STRAIGHT TIME.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- No possession of firearms or ammunition.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- No contact with the Edward C or Scoteria F.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution set at zero; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Case in court for jury trial, however parties would like to proceed with a plea hearing instead.  As to Counts 1 & 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead NO CONTEST and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Defendant Devontae L White in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Defendant Devontae L White in custody.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
BRANCH 22 FOR BRANCH 35.
Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  
Court ordered Count 2 amended to Disorderly Conduct While Armed, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes sections 947.01(1) and 939.63(1)(a), a Class B Misdemeanor.

Defendant Devontae L White in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Defendant Devontae L White in custody.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. No motions filed by defense. Matter is still in trial posture. Matter remains scheduled for jury trial on 9/2/15 at 9:30am in Br. 35.
- filed by the State.

- filed.

Attorney Daniel E Meylink in court, defendant Devontae L White not in court, in custody.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for final pretrial on 8.5.15 and for jury trial on 9.2.15.  Motion hearing scheduled for 08-05-2015 at 08:30 am.  All parties notified as of August 03, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35, in room 629 of the courthouse.
Speedy trial demand.

Defendant Devontae L White in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Defendant Devontae L White in custody.  Nathaniel Adamson for Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Leo Carter-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Edward C. and Scoteria F.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Devontae L White in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Devontae L White in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant as to Count 1.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
